description.narrative: From God to Man is a group of 50 farmers who produce rice in Doumpa County in Nimba District of Liberia. The project will focus on adding value to their product by beginning to parboil rice. Funds will be used to purchase equipment, get access to working capital and provide training in cooperative capacity building including financial management, organizational development, marketing, and cooperative governance.

description.narrative: KWAC is an organization of 25 women in Kesseh Town in Careysburg District that is focused on adding value to the cassava that they produce. description.narrative: Sector: Cassava. Beneficiaries: 1200 (700 women). Description: The Liberia Business Incubator generates revenue through the sale of value-added locally grown produce. This grant will enable the institution to purchase better equipment and improve processing facilities for cassava processing, and increase the overall production of cassava. When the production is increased, the demand for raw materials (cassava) will encourage farmers to grow more crops. Additionally, the grant will enable farmers to be trained in using improved methods of farming.

title.narrative: Supporting Livelihoods & Improving Incomes for Rice Farmers Liberia

description.narrative: FABRAR purchases locally grown rice from farmers before processing the rice at a standard acceptable to all buyers. FABRAR also works with the farmers to increase their production of paddy rice. Currently, the company operates within Margibi County and buys rice from farmers in the area surrounding Kakata. FABRAR needs additional rice milling equipment, capital and technical assistance to be able to purchase and process more rice from the local farmers and obtain a higher value and additional customers for the processed rice it sells.

description.narrative: The Gbehlay-Geh Rural Women Farmers Multipurpose Cooperative Society initial shareholders are 90 farmers (80 females and 10 males) in (Khan Play) who currently produce gari, rice, palm oil, and vegetables as their main surplus food crop. In this follow-on expansion project, they will engage in the buying of raw cassava and production of premium quality gari for sale to the consumer on the Liberian market, particularly in Monrovia, Ganta, Sanniquelle and other major cities in Nimba County. Two grades of gari will be produced and sold, premium and coarse.,
